result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandy L Bond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Brandy L Bond was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandy L Bond is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Brandy L Bond was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges associated.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Court vacated the Probation sentence and ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $500, including all applicable costs & surcharges, by 01-11-16.  Failure to pay will result ina civil judgment.

withheld sentence vacated

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter here for sentencing on the withheld sentence.  Defendant rejected probation.  Court vacated the probation sentence.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $500.00  including all applicable costs and surcharges to be paid by 1/11/16.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE FILE.
Defendant Brandy Bond called the court and stated that she wished to decline her probation sentence and requested a sentencing hearing. Defendant was informed to file a written request regarding her sentence, and advised that if she failed to comply with the terms of probation a warrant may be issued for her arrest. Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10/12/15 at 8:30am in branch 40.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 664
cf

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense.  Additional statements by: John T.   Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  
AS TO COUNT 3 (AMENDED):
COURT WITHHELD THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges associated.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

At the hour of 4:33pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought verdicts of NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2, and GUILTY AS TO COUNT 3 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict as to count 3 and granted defense motion for judgment on the verdicts as to counts 1 and 2, and denied motion for acquittal notwithstanding as to count 3.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction as to count 3 and judgment of acquittal as to counts 1 and 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared with Porshia Lewand for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury in the box at 10:04am. Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  Ofc. Zachary Johnson, MPD, Ofc. Ryan Dummann, MPD. Exhibits 10-15 received. Jury out of the box at 10:39am. Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify. Jury in the box at 11:24am. State rests. Defense reserves motion. Sworn for the defense: Brandy Bond. Defense rests. Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Ofc. Ryan Dummann. State and Defense rest. Testimony closed. Jury out of the box at 11:50am. Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence denied by the court. Case passed to 1:30pm.

Jury in box at 1:47pm.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:52 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies S. Urbaniak and M. Tinsley who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Owen M. Piotrowski and Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Jury in  the box at 8:48 am. Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  John T. II.  Exhibit #'s 1,2,3,4 and 5 received and published to the jury.  Sworn for the state:  Ericka B.  Exhibit #'s 6,7,8 and 9 received and published to the jury.  Jury out of the box.

Defendant in court with Attorney Rodney Cubbie. Owen Piotrowski appeared with Porshia Lewand for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  3:15.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Jury out of the box at 4:20pm.
Jury in the box at 4:31pm. Opening statements proceeded.
Jury excused for the day at 4:45pm. Trial to continue 8/25/15 at 8:45am.

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared with Porshia Lewand for the State of Wisconsin. Parties prepared to proceed to trial. Case adjourned to 1:30.  Jury trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial in Branch 40.
Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.

Brandy Bond's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court with attorney Rodney L. Cubbie.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Attorney Cubbie has just been retained and would like the 6/15/15 jury trial adjourned.  Court granted the request.  At the request of the state, Court admonished defendant and advised her to have no more contact with the alleged victim's mother or sister.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Brandy Bond's Motion to Adjourn Trial received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant indicated she was going to hire counsel, when Court ordered matter adjourned for status of counsel, defendant informed the Court she did not want counsel.  Court examined the defendant regarding her right to counsel and found she freely, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived her right to counsel.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Remaining bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with John T., Erika B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandy L Bond in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 40.
Case recalled at 3:04. William Beherns appeared for the state.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/8/15 @ 1:30pm
